summary: User timeline_7 chronicles struggles with OCD and anxiety, showing gradual improvement with therapy.

posts.text: Three weeks without self-harming. used my DBT skills So proud of myself. I acknowledge my progress Almost slipped up. I want to give up on everything But I reached out for help instead. I acknowledge my progress
maladaptive_evidence: I want to give up on everything
posts.summary: Post shows active coping and progress despite challenges

posts.text: My partner and I have been fighting constantly. I'm broken beyond repair I feel like I'm ruining everything. I'm failing at everything We decided to try couples therapy. reached out to my therapist Had our first session and it went better than expected. Things can get better
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: Another day of feeling terrible. I'm broken beyond repair I don't care about anything anymore Went outside for 10 minutes. did some self-care activities Called a friend. I'm learning healthier coping skills
maladaptive_evidence: I don't care about anything anymore
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: The new medication makes me feel numb. I have no reason to keep going I don't feel like myself anymore. I'm losing my mind Scheduled an appointment to discuss adjusting the dosage. practiced my coping strategies Keeping a mood journal to track changes. I'm building a support system
maladaptive_evidence: I have no reason to keep going
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: The constant worry is exhausting. Life is meaningless I can't focus on anything. I've been drinking to cope My therapist recommended meditation so I took my medication as prescribed and I deserve to get better
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: Can't handle the pressure anymore. I'm broken beyond repair I've been drinking to cope Started setting better boundaries at work. took my medication as prescribed Learned to say no to extra projects. I'm proud of myself for trying
adaptive_evidence: I'm proud of myself for trying
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: Thinking about stopping my meds. I'm broken beyond repair I'm losing my mind Called my psychiatrist first. talked to a friend about what I'm going through We're trying a different medication instead. I'm building a support system
adaptive_evidence: talked to a friend about what I'm going through
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: Thinking about stopping my meds. I'm disgusting I've been having suicidal thoughts Called my psychiatrist first. joined a support group We're trying a different medication instead. I deserve to get better
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: Three weeks without self-harming. practiced my coping strategies So proud of myself. I'm worth the effort Almost slipped up. I have no reason to keep going But I reached out for help instead. I'm worth the effort
maladaptive_evidence: I have no reason to keep going
posts.summary: Post shows active coping and progress despite challenges

posts.text: I feel like such a failure. I'm a burden to everyone Can't stop thinking about hurting myself. I'm spiraling out of control But I remembered my safety plan tried a new coping mechanism and texted my sponsor. I'm committed to my recovery
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: I feel anxious all the time. I feel empty inside I gave up trying Started using the coping strategies from therapy. wrote in my journal I'm trying to be patient with myself. I'm building a support system
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping

posts.text: I feel like such a failure. Nothing will ever get better Can't stop thinking about hurting myself. I stopped taking my medication But I remembered my safety plan set healthy boundaries and texted my sponsor. Taking it one day at a time
adaptive_evidence: Taking it one day at a time
posts.summary: Post shows mixed emotional state with both struggles and coping
